result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Luis Ott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. Straight time.

Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge in this case as it has been ordered in 15CF531.
Pay all other costs and surcharges. To be paid out of up to 25% of any prison funds, if applicable. Balance to be paid by the end of ES in case 15CF531 and 15CF989.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
___________________________
No contact with Compassionate Doctor's Inc. located at 1672 S. 9 Street, Milwaukee, WI.; Walmart at 3355 S. 27 Street, Milwaukee, WI; Blue Kanagroo Laundromat at 1115 W. Greenfield Ave, Milwaukee, WI.; Econo Lodge at 6541 S. 13 Street, Milwaukee, WI.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Luis Ott

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  Additional statement by Carolina L.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served. STRAIGHT TIME.  

Defendant to have no contact with:  Compassionate Doctor's Inc. located at 1672 S. 9th St., Milwaukee, WI., Walmart located at 3355 S. 27th St. Milwaukee, WI., Blue Kangaroo Laundromat located at 1115 W. Greenfield Ave. Milwaukee, WI., Econo Lodge located at 6541 S. 13th St. Milwaukee, WI.

Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge in this case as it has been ordered in 15CF531.
- Pay all costs and surcharges out of up to 25 % of any prison funds, if applicable, any balance to be paid by the end of ES in case 15CF531 and 15CF989.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Restitution will be determined at sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst for Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea date.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel in court and requests jury trial on defendant's case #15CF531 and 15CF989.  Case is adjourned for Status conference in Branch 26.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp   Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-24-2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GULTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 26.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, Defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for Tyrone Martin St. junior for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced for purposes of this hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has a pending felony in Branch 24.  Defense counsel advised the Court that Branch 26 has agreed to accept this case as part of a global resolution.  Court ordered case transferred to Judge Pocan, Branch 26 for a scheduling conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY Blue Kangaroo Laundromats or their employees

Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
